div1.head: Military Orders for Thomas M. England, July 31, 1901
div1.p:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 61 - 1901
England

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 164. }

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, July 31, 1901.

1. The following named privates of the Hospital Corps,
U. S. Army, having been examined by the boards of medical
officers convened by paragraphs 2 and 3, Special Orders
No. 142, current series, these Headquarters, to determine
their fitness for the position of acting hospital steward, and
having been found qualified, are hereby detailed as Acting
Hospital Stewards, and will report for duty to the com-
manding officers of the stations set opposite their respective
names, viz:

William H. Winger, Manzanillo;
✓
Thomas M. England, Hamilton Barracks, Matanzas;
Thomas R. Kane, Columbia Barracks;
Roderick C. Boyer, Pirotecnia Militar;
Charles J. Heeb, San Luis, Santiago.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Under the provisions of A. R. 1410, the Subsistence
Department will commute the rations of Post Quartermaster
Sergeant George Wirth, U. S. Army, now on duty at Rowell
Barracks. Pasa Caballos, Cuba, from and including July
26, 1901, and while on such duty, at the rate of seventy-
five (75) cents per day, it having been and being impracti-
cable to provide for his subsistence in any other way.

3. The unexecuted portion of sentence of general court-
martial in the case of private John D. Brower, 18th company,
Coast Artillery, published in paragraph 22, Special Orders
No. 97, current series, these Headquarters, is hereby
remitted.

The soldier will be released from confinement and re-
stored to duty with his company.

4. Post Quartermaster Sergeant John Delmar, U. S.
Army, now at Hamilton Barracks, Matanzas, Cuba, will,
in compliance with paragraph 24, Special Orders No. 170,
current series, Headquarters of the Army, proceed to Fort
Yellowstone, Wyoming, reporting upon arrival to the com-
manding officer for duty.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation, and the Subsistence Department will
commute his rations, in advance, at the authorized rate,
for three (3) days, for that part of the journey to be
performed by rail, it being impracticable for this soldier to
carry rations of any kind.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

5. 1st Lieutenant C. F. Armistead, Artillery Corps, is
hereby relieved as Judge Advocate of the general court-
martial appointed to meet at Columbia Barracks, Cuba, by
paragraph 4, Special Orders No. 131, current series, these
Headquarters, and 1st Lieutenant J. C. Rhea, 7th Cavalry,
detailed in his stead.

Lieutenant Armistead will transfer to Lieutenant Rhea
all unfinished cases referred to the court for trial in which
no arraignment has been had.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Captain 7th Cavalry,
Adjutant General.
